revised_title: The Path and Nature of Slow Contractile Waves in Arthropod Muscle Fibres
tldr: The authors studied the slow contractile wave in arthropod muscle fibers using photographic recordings. They discovered that the wave moves along the helicoidal cross-membranes, suggesting that these membranes may provide the path of conduction. This finding has important implications for understanding muscle fiber contraction and the role of cross-striation in muscle physiology.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
